TypeSignature.Value: public class AccessibilityNodeInfo : Java.Lang.Object, Android.OS.IParcelable, IDisposable
.class public auto ansi beforefieldinit AccessibilityNodeInfo extends Java.Lang.Object implements class Android.OS.IParcelable, class Android.Runtime.IJavaObject, class System.IDisposable

Docs.summary: This class represents a node of the window content as well as actions that can be requested from its source.

remarks.para: This class represents a node of the window content as well as actions that can be requested from its source. From the point of view of an a window content is presented as tree of accessibility node info which may or may not map one-to-one to the view hierarchy. In other words, a custom view is free to report itself as a tree of accessibility node info.
Once an accessibility node info is delivered to an accessibility service it is made immutable and calling a state mutation method generates an error.
Please refer to for details about how to obtain a handle to window content as a tree of accessibility node info as well as familiarizing with the security model.
For more information about making applications accessible, read the Accessibility developer guide.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void AddChild (Android.Views.View root, int virtualDescendantId);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void AddChild(class Android.Views.View root, int32 virtualDescendantId) cil managed

Docs.param: The root of the virtual subtree.
The id of the virtual child.
Docs.summary: Adds a virtual child which is a descendant of the given root.

remarks.para: Adds a virtual child which is a descendant of the given root. If virtualDescendantId is the root is added as a child.

A virtual descendant is an imaginary View that is reported as a part of the view hierarchy for accessibility purposes. This enables custom views that draw complex content to report them selves as a tree of virtual views, thus conveying their logical structure.

Docs.summary: Gets an optional bundle with extra data.

remarks.para: Gets an optional bundle with extra data. The bundle is lazily created and never null.

Note: It is recommended to use the package name of your application as a prefix for the keys to avoid collisions which may confuse an accessibility service if the same key has different meaning when emitted from different applications.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Collections.Generic.IList`1<class Android.Views.Accessibility.AccessibilityNodeInfo> FindAccessibilityNodeInfosByText(string text) cil managed

Docs.summary: Finds s by text.

remarks.para: Finds s by text. The match is case insensitive containment. The search is relative to this info i.e. this info is the root of the traversed tree.
Note: It is a client responsibility to recycle the received info by calling to avoid creating of multiple instances.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Collections.Generic.IList`1<class Android.Views.Accessibility.AccessibilityNodeInfo> FindAccessibilityNodeInfosByViewId(string viewId) cil managed

Docs.param: The fully qualified resource name of the view id to find.
Docs.summary: Finds s by the fully qualified view id's resource name where a fully qualified id is of the from "package:id/id_resource_name".

remarks.para: Finds s by the fully qualified view id's resource name where a fully qualified id is of the from "package:id/id_resource_name". For example, if the target application's package is "foo.bar" and the id resource name is "baz", the fully qualified resource id is "foo.bar:id/baz".
Note: It is a client responsibility to recycle the received info by calling to avoid creating of multiple instances.
Note: The primary usage of this API is for UI test automation and in order to report the fully qualified view id if an the client has to set the flag when configuring his .

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Android.Views.AccessibilityLiveRegion LiveRegion { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets the node's live region mode.

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Gets the node's live region mode.
A live region is a node that contains information that is important for the user and when it changes the user should be notified. For example, in a login screen with a TextView that displays an "incorrect password" notification, that view should be marked as a live region with mode .
It is the responsibility of the accessibility service to monitor events indicating changes to live region nodes and their children.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Sets the node's live region mode. Note: Cannot be called from an . This class is made immutable before being delivered to an AccessibilityService.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void SetLabeledBy (Android.Views.View root, int virtualDescendantId);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetLabeledBy(class Android.Views.View root, int32 virtualDescendantId) cil managed

Docs.param: The root whose virtual descendant labels this node's source.
The id of the virtual descendant.
Docs.summary: Sets the view which serves as the label of the view represented by this info for accessibility purposes.

remarks.para: Sets the view which serves as the label of the view represented by this info for accessibility purposes. If virtualDescendantId is the root is set as the label.

A virtual descendant is an imaginary View that is reported as a part of the view hierarchy for accessibility purposes. This enables custom views that draw complex content to report themselves as a tree of virtual views, thus conveying their logical structure.
Note: Cannot be called from an . This class is made immutable before being delivered to an AccessibilityService.

Docs.value: A which contains the java.lang.Class JNI value corresponding to this type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.
